au.edu.rmit.tzar.api

Class Parameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.rmit.tzar.api.Parameters

  • public class Parameters
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a set of parameters for a run.

                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> inputFiles,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> outputFiles)
                                   throws TzarException
        Factory method to create a new Parameters object. Verifies that there are no duplicate keys.
        Parameters:
        variables -
        inputFiles -
        outputFiles -
        Returns:
        a new Parameters object
        Throws:
        TzarException - if there are duplicate keys

      • getQualifiedParams

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getQualifiedParams(java.io.File baseInputPath,
                                                                  java.io.File baseOutputPath)
        Returns a map of keys to parameters (variables, input_files and output_files), where the input and output filenames are qualified by the provided baseInputPath and baseOutputPaths respectively.
        Parameters:
        baseInputPath - the absolute base path for input files
        baseOutputPath - the absolute base path for output files
        Returns:
        a Map of qualified parameters

      • getVariables

        public  getVariables()
        Map of keys to values of type String, Integer, Boolean or BigDecimal.

      • getInputFiles

        public  getInputFiles()
        Map of keys to input file names. These can be qualified by an input file path using getQualifiedParams.

      • getOutputFiles

        public  getOutputFiles()
        Map of keys to output file names. These can be qualified by an output file path using getQualifiedParams.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Gets the total number of parameters defined.
        Returns:
        total number of parameters

      • mergeParameters

        public Parameters mergeParameters(Parameters overrideParameters)
                           throws TzarException
        Merges two Parameters objects. This Object is considered to be the "base" and the other the "override". This method returns a new Parameters object constructed from the unions of each of the maps contained in each Parameters object (that is, a new Parameters object containing the union of the 'variables' map from each object, the union of the 'inputFiles' map from each object, and the union of the 'outputFiles' map from each object. Where there is a key collision between two maps, the value will be chosen from the overrideParameters object's map.
        Parameters:
        overrideParameters -
        Returns:
        a new Parameters object containing a merged version of the two provided Parameters objects
        Throws:
        TzarException

      • mergeParameters

        public Parameters mergeParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> variables,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> inputFiles,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> outputFiles)
                           throws TzarException
        Throws:
        TzarException

      • replaceWildcards

        public Parameters replaceWildcards(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> wildcards)
        Replaces any of the provided wildcard keys (as delimited by $$$$) with the provided values.

        For example, if we pass in a wildcards Map containing key:base_path, and value: "/foo", then if one of the parameter values of this object has name base_path and value, "$$path$$/somewhere", then this method will return a Parameters object containing a parameter with name: base_path, value: "/foo/somewhere".

        Parameters:
        wildcards - a map of wildcard names to their corresponding values
        Returns:
        a new Parameters object with all wildcard values (in variables, inputFiles and outputFiles) replaced by the provided values.
